text: (bright music)

- Taco Bell is known for
innovation in the QSR space,

but not many people
know that we're striving
to be second to none with our technology.
Our parent company, Yum! Brands,
actually built a headless commerce engine,
and we decided we wanted to migrate

as quickly as possible
using AWS and serverless.
This was a big, bold, ambitious goal,

and we decided to use
Trek10 to help us with it.

- So we've had a very long
history with the Taco Bell team
over the last three years.

We've continued to develop and
grow as we've supported them,
as they've built out their AWS footprint.
- Our main goal was really to not disrupt
any breaking backend API changes
so that it is seamless to the customers.
Our new e-commerce systems leverage a lot

of the different services
from AWS, for instance,

Lambdas, S3, API Gateway,
EventBridge, and DynamoDB.

Prior to being on AWS, our
monolithic e-commerce system used

to take around 30 minutes
to ship maybe a tiny change

of code to our lower environment
or even like production,
but now with AWS serverless,

we were able to deploy
within like five minutes.
- The benefit in this particular case
of having Trek10 on the project is we have

such a ridiculous amount
of expertise in serverless,
so this is right up our alley.

So having us on the
project definitely brings

that like deep expertise in
all things serverless on AWS.

- Transitioning over to our
new serverless architecture has

been instrumental for
our digital channels.
Previously, we were always concerned

whether or not our
architecture would be able

to handle the high load
during promotional campaigns.
However, once we migrated over
to our new serverless architecture

and Yum! Commerce engine,
we were able to gain

a greater confidence
in our system's ability

to handle high traffic on
promotional campaign days.
- And with the serverless solution,

we've seen cost reductions of
90% for our infrastructure.
We've seen the reduction of complexity
in our code also by 90%.

We've been able to ship
business value faster
than ever before.
At the end of the day,
we're just here to delight our customers.

So they don't know how we're
building this in the backend.

They don't know that
we're using serverless.

They're just happy that we're
giving them what they need.

- I really appreciate
working with Taco Bell

because they really are on
the cutting edge of pushing

kind of the bounds of
what serverless can do.

It really allows us to
challenge ourselves at Trek10

to continue to learn and grow
and use AWS to its fullest.
(bright music)
